q: Speaking with Matt Lauer on The Today Show Tuesday, former American Idol judge, Simon Cowell , admitted that he doesn't regularly watch American Idol now that he is back in the UK involved in other projects. It's on a different time here in the UK, Simon Cowell said.`` I watched some clips last week to get up to speed, and it looked good.'' Asked about the new judges, he said,`` I think they're doing fine

, which Simon Cowell said won't be a`` dressed up'' sum: The top contestant will get$ 1 million a year for five years, separate from the costs involved in recording and promotion. It's a massive, massive risk but it's also an incredible incentive. It puts everybody, rightly, under an enormous amount of pressure, Simon Cowell said, adding,`` I believe I can find a star.'' Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo.`` They don't like me for making these requests,'' said Zahi Hawass .`` But I do

The ruling party headquarters building next door to the museum was still in flames and billowing black smoke into the sky on Saturday, a day after protesters torched it during mass anti-government demonstrations. What scares me is that if this building is destroyed, it will fall over the museum, antiquities boss Zahi Hawass said as he watched fire trucks try to extinguish the blaze in the NDP headquarters.
